member.name: T:DbExtensions.AssociationAttribute
member.summary: Designates a property to represent a database association, such as a foreign key relationship.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.AssociationAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a constraint.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.AssociationAttribute.OtherKey
member.summary: Gets or sets one or more members of the target entity class as key values on the other side of the association.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.AssociationAttribute.ThisKey
member.summary: Gets or sets members of this entity class to represent the key values on this side of the association.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.AutoSync
member.summary: Used to specify for during INSERT and UPDATE operations when a data member should be read back after the operation completes.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AutoSync.Default
member.summary: Automatically selects the value.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AutoSync.Always
member.summary: Always returns the value.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AutoSync.Never
member.summary: Never returns the value.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AutoSync.OnInsert
member.summary: Returns the value only after an INSERT operation.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AutoSync.OnUpdate
member.summary: Returns the value only after an UPDATE operation.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.ChangeConflictException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when a concurrency violation is encountered while saving to the database. A concurrency violation occurs when an unexpected number of rows are affected during save. This is usually because the data in the database has been modified since it was loaded into memory.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.ChangeConflictException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute
member.summary: Associates a property with a column in a database table.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.AutoSync
member.summary: Gets or sets the enumeration.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.ConvertTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the type to convert this member to before sending to the database.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.IsDbGenerated
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a column contains values that the database auto-generates.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this class member represents a column that is part or all of the primary key of the table.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.IsVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the column type of the member is a database timestamp or version number.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.ColumnAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a column.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.Database
member.summary: Provides simple data access using , and .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided connection.
member.param: The connection.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided connection string.
member.param: The connection string.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided connection string and provider's invariant name.
member.param: The connection string.
The provider's invariant name.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.Database.Configuration
member.summary: Provides access to configuration options for this instance.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.Database.Connection
member.summary: Gets the connection to associate with new commands.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.CreateCommand(DbExtensions.SqlBuilder)
member.summary: Creates and returns an object from the specified .
member.param: The that provides the command's text and parameters.
member.returns: A new object whose property is initialized with the 's string representation, and whose property is initialized with the values from the property of the parameter.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.CreateCommand(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and returns an object using the provided as a composite format string (as used on ), where the format items are replaced with appropiate parameter names, and the objects in the array are added to the command's collection.
member.param: The command text.

The array of parameters to be passed to the command. Note the following behavior: If the number of objects in the array is less than the highest number identified in the command string, an exception is thrown. If the array contains objects that are not referenced in the command string, no exception is thrown. If a parameter is null, it is converted to DBNull.Value.
member.returns: A new object whose property is initialized with the parameter, and whose property is initialized with the values from the parameter.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources used by this instance.
member.param: true if this method is being called due to a call to ; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.EnsureConnectionOpen
member.summary: Opens (if it's not open) and returns an object you can use to close it (if it wasn't open).
member.returns: An object to close the connection.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.EnsureInTransaction
member.summary: Returns a virtual transaction that you can use to ensure a code block is always executed in a transaction, new or existing.
member.returns: A virtual transaction you can use to ensure a code block is always executed in a transaction, new or existing.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.EnsureInTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Returns a virtual transaction that you can use to ensure a code block is always executed in a transaction, new or existing.
member.param: Specifies the isolation level for the transaction. This parameter is ignored when using an existing transaction.
member.returns: A virtual transaction you can use to ensure a code block is always executed in a transaction, new or existing.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.Execute(DbExtensions.SqlBuilder,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the command. Optionally uses a transaction and validates affected records value before committing.
member.param: The non-query command to execute.
The number of records the command should affect. This value is ignored if less or equal to -1.
true if the number of affected records should exactly match ; false if a lower number is acceptable.
member.returns: The number of affected records.
member.exception: The number of affected records is not equal to .

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.Execute(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates and executes an using the provided as a composite format string (as used on ), where the format items are replaced with appropiate parameter names, and the objects in the array are added to the command's collection.
member.param: The command text.
The parameters to apply to the command text.
member.returns: The number of affected records.

member.returns: The results of the query as objects.

member.summary: Maps the results of the to dynamic objects. The query is deferred-executed.

The query.
member.returns: The results of the query as objects of type specified by the parameter.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.Database.QuoteIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Given an unquoted identifier in the correct catalog case, returns the correct quoted form of that identifier, including properly escaping any embedded quotes in the identifier.
member.param: The original unquoted identifier.
member.returns: The quoted version of the identifier. Embedded quotes within the identifier are properly escaped.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration
member.summary: Holds configuration options that customize the behavior of . This class cannot be instantiated, to get an instance use the property.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.DefaultConnectionString
member.summary: The connection string to use as default.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.DefaultProviderInvariantName
member.summary: The provider's invariant name to use as default.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.EnableBatchCommands
member.summary: true to execute batch commands when possible; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.LastInsertIdCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL command that returns the last identity value generated on the database.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.Log
member.summary: Specifies the destination to write the SQL query or command.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.ParameterNameBuilder
member.summary: Specifies a function that prepares a parameter name to be used on .

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.ParameterPlaceholderBuilder
member.summary: Specifies a function that builds a parameter placeholder to be used in SQL statements.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.QuotePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the beginning character or characters to use when specifying database objects (for example, tables or columns) whose names contain characters such as spaces or reserved tokens.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.QuoteSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the ending character or characters to use when specifying database objects (for example, tables or columns) whose names contain characters such as spaces or reserved tokens.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.UseVersionMember
member.summary: true to include version column check in SQL statements' predicates; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlBuilder._(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Appends to the current clause. This method is a shortcut for .

member.returns: A reference to this instance after the append operation has completed.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlBuilder._ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Func{``0,System.Object[]})
member.summary: Appends to the current clause the string made by concatenating an for each element in , interspersed with .
member.param: The collection of objects that contain parameters.
The clause body format string, which must contain a {0} placeholder. This parameter can be null.
The item format.
The string to use as separator between each item format.
The delegate that extract parameters for each element in . This parameter can be null.
member.returns: A reference to this instance after the append operation has completed.

member.returns: A reference to this instance after the append operation has completed.

member.returns: The single element of the set that satisfies the condition, or a default value if no such element is found.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlSet`1.Skip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Bypasses a specified number of elements in the set and then returns the remaining elements.
member.param: The number of elements to skip before returning the remaining elements.
member.returns: A new that contains the elements that occur after the specified index in the current set.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlSet`1.Take(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the start of the set.
member.param: The number of elements to return.
member.returns: A new that contains the specified number of elements from the start of the current set.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlSet`1.ToArray
member.summary: Creates an array from the set.
member.returns: An array that contains the elements from the set.

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlSet`1.ToList

member.name: T:DbExtensions.SqlTable

member.name: M:DbExtensions.SqlTable.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Recursively executes INSERT commands for the specified and all its one-to-one and one-to-many associations.
member.param: The object whose INSERT command is to be executed. This parameter is named entity for consistency with the other CRUD methods, but in this case it doesn't need to be an actual entity, which means it doesn't need to have a primary key.
